713.description:
b'Kevin walked into the kitchen while Alice grabbed a wineglass. "Could you tell me where the juice and spoon are?" Kevin asked. Alice, walking to the microwave, responded, "The juice and a spoon are both inside the kitchen cabinet, there's another spoon in a different part of the cabinet, and yet another one is inside the dishwasher in the kitchen." Kevin then walked to a wineglass and grabbed it while Alice walked to another wineglass and grabbed it. Kevin grabbed another wineglass and walked to the kitchen table as Alice walked to the kitchen table and put the wineglass down.

Kevin put the wineglass on the kitchen table while Alice opened a kitchen cabinet. Kevin then walked to the dishwasher as Alice opened another kitchen cabinet. Kevin opened the dishwasher while Alice walked to a spoon. Kevin opened the microwave as Alice grabbed the spoon. Kevin grabbed a spoon while Alice put the spoon on the kitchen table. Kevin opened the kitchen cabinet while Alice walked to another spoon. Kevin grabbed the juice as Alice grabbed the spoon. Kevin put the juice on the kitchen table while Alice walked to the kitchen table and put the spoon down. 

Alice then opened the fridge while Kevin did not perform any actions. Alice grabbed a bottle of wine and another bottle of wine. She put one bottle of wine on the kitchen table and then the other bottle of wine on the kitchen table.'

questions.1:
Given the above interaction, if Alice wants to hinder Kevin from achieving his goal, which of the following locations did Alice least likely believe the juice was located when giving information?
    A) Living room
    B) Microwave
    C) Kitchen cabinet
questions.2:
Given the above interaction, if Alice wants to hinder Kevin from achieving his goal, which of the following objects did Alice least likely believe was located inside the kitchen cabinet when giving information?
    A) Juice
    B) Wineglass
    C) Fork
questions.3:
Given the above interaction, assuming that Alice believes that the juice is inside the kitchen cabinet, when giving information, Alice is most likely:
    A) Trying to help
    B) Trying to hinder
    C) Neither trying to help nor hinder
questions.4:
Given the above interaction, assuming that Alice believes that there is nothing worthwhile inside the kitchen cabinet, when giving information, Alice is most likely:
    A) Trying to help
    B) Trying to hinder
    C) Neither trying to help nor hinder
questions.5:
Given the above interaction, assuming that Alice believes the juice is only in the microwave, when giving information, Alice is most likely:
    A) Trying to help
    B) Trying to hinder
    C) Neither trying to help nor hinder
